meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be machined.
meanings.sent1: The machinabilities of this metal make it ideal for manufacturing parts.
meanings.sent2: Engineers consider the machinabilities of different materials when designing products.
meanings.sent3: The robot was jealous of the metal's machinabilities because it couldn't be machined.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity had machinabilities that allowed her to craft intricate designs effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The machinabilities of the wood were so poor that the carpenter struggled to shape it.

meanings.definition: The ability of a material to be easily worked with a machine.
meanings.sent1: Manufacturers value the machinabilities of plastics for their ease of processing.
meanings.sent2: The machinabilities of this alloy allow for precise cutting and shaping.
meanings.sent3: The machinabilities of the rubber were so impressive that the machine worked faster than ever.
meanings.sent4: His mind had machinabilities that enabled him to process information quickly like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The machinabilities of the fabric were so remarkable that the tailor finished the dress in record time.
